thread.title: States Consider Laws Allowing Courts to Take Guns From Dangerous People

author: Jon Kamp
title: States Consider Laws Allowing Courts to Take Guns From Dangerous People
text:
Lawmakers in at least 24 states from Hawaii to Maryland are pushing bills that would allow courts to temporarily take guns from people deemed dangerous, a gun-control concept gaining ground as a politically feasible response to last month’s shooting in Florida.
The idea—known as red-flag laws—has gained momentum after the mass shooting at a Parkland, Fla., high school that left 17 people dead. A handful of states, such as California and Connecticut, already have such laws, but the concept is catching on, including in Florida,...
